data.name: Simcoe Steam
data.description: This inaugural beer from our new steam powered brewery has a rich caramelised malt base on top of which the hops bring flavours of passionfruit and apricot, with a gentle pine finish.

style.name: California Common Beer
style.description: California Common Beer is light amber to amber in color and is medium bodied. There is a noticeable degree of caramel-type malt character in flavor and often in aroma. Hop bitterness impression is medium to medium high and is balanced with a low to medium-low degree of fruity esters and malt character and give an impression of balance and drinkability. Hop flavor and aroma is low to medium-low. California Common Beer is a style of beer brewed with lager yeasts but at ale fermentation temperatures. Diacetyl and chill haze should be absent.

breweries.description: A Bristol based brewery. Find our beer at destinations across the country and further afield. We hope you enjoy the drinking as much as we did the brewing.

breweries.name: Gaslight Brewery & Restaurant
breweries.description: We are a family owned and operated Brew-Pub. The only one in Essex County. We make handcrafted Ales and Lagers using traditional brewing techniques and only the finest ingredients. Our food is made from from the freshest ingredients all prepared from scratch on our premises. We have a full service pastry shop where all desserts and breads are created. We take great pride in preparation, presentation and service.

data.name: Steam Beer
data.description: California Common Beer, a lager brewed at ale temp producing a light fruitiness combined with malt-forward flavor with hints of caramel and toffee. Bittered with Perle hops, this beer’s flavor is there one moment and gone the next. 5.1% ABV, 30 IBU’s

breweries.name: Woodward Avenue Brewers
breweries.description: Woodward Avenue Brewers, or “WAB”, as we're affectionately called, is much more than a restaurant or bar. Established in 1997, The WAB has become a landmark along Woodward Avenue in Ferndale and has welcomed visitors – those in the neighborhood and those far and wide – for more than 16 years. Pioneers of the craft brew scene, WAB is the go-to gathering place for patrons to enjoy handcrafted brews, great food, friendly atmosphere and the action on historic Woodward Avenue.

data.name: Steam Beer
data.description: A truly american style of beer that originated on the west coast.  This brew is aggressively hopped with a rich malty base and the sweetness of crystal malt.  Anchors away!!!

style.name: California Common Beer

breweries.name: High Desert Brewing Co.
breweries.description: After years of recipe development, remodeling, and parking lot paving, the High Desert Brewing Co. opened it's doors in July of 1997 and has quickly become one of New Mexico's premier brewpubs. Our selection of hand crafted lagers and ales are produced on premises using the finest grains and hops. We brew small batches of about 100 gallons, ensuring that each beer is served at the peak of freshness. Our brews are available by the glass, pint, or pitcher and to-go in 1/2 gallon growlers and 5 gallon kegs. We make every attempt to keep all of our beers on tap at all times but once in a while one or two may not be available for a few days. These times are the perfect opportunity to stretch your taste and try something other than your favorite. Please let Bob or Donna, or any of the High Desert Brewing Co. staff know how you think we are doing.

breweries.name: Fountain Square Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Back in the Summer of 2011, we got the crazy idea to startup a brewery, not because we wanted to be on the bandwagon, but because we wanted something different, something our talents and passion for beer could make happen. Out technical background in Microbiology, Chemistry, and Automation, made up the perfect storm needed to produce quality beer with a higher level of consistency and with improved shelf stability. Our passion for beer and diversity of tastes allowed us to craft carefully refined recipes that we know will delight you.

We chose Fountain Square because of the community. Since we will be the first to admit our creativity and talents exist on a side of the brain that has little capability to draw, we have this admiration and attraction to those whose talents reside in the arts. We have connected to this community over the past year and look forward to being a vehicle for expressing its artistic nature. Fountain Square is a community of hard working, creative, fun loving, and genuine people. They are probably the most helpful people we've ever met. We are truly honored to be a part of the community and will strive to be worthy ambassadors and stewards.

data.name: Steam Engine Common
data.description: This California Common Ale is a slice of heaven! It's a lager brewed at ale temperatures which results in a crisp, clean flavor up front and a slightly hoppy finish. This is our easy drinking session beer. Not ready for a heavy beer or going for a 50 mile bike ride? This is it.

breweries.name: Firetrucker Brewery
breweries.description: Firetrucker beers are loaded with flavor and maintain a clean finish. Our Steam, Ginger and IPAs stand out, but the house line up of dark beers goes over the top. Many of our porters and stouts have a smoky companion, compliments of our in-house smoked and milled grains. Each month, our seasonal beers push the boundaries while complimenting the time of year. Craft beer is art! Enjoy!

breweries.name: Titletown Brewing
breweries.description: Titletown Brewing Co was founded in 1996 inside the historic Chicago Northwestern Train Depot in the heart of Green Bay, WI.  The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: 11am - 9pm 7 days a week

data.name: Steamboat Common
data.description: "Steamboat Common" is a play on the words "Steamboat Comin' " and is a collaboration between Great Crescent Brewery and New Albanian Brewing Company. Steamboat Common was created to celebrate the 200th anniversary of the first steamboat trip on "Western Waters" back in 1811. Steamboat Common is based on recipes that would have been typical for the 1811 timeframe and is best described as a lightly smoked brown ale. The addition of molassis and sorghum give this beer a slight haze and the flavors come through in the finish.

breweries.name: Great Crescent Brewery
breweries.description:
The Great Crescent Brewery beers are made with all malt, fresh hops and whole ingredients. Every beer is hand-crafted in small batches using traditional brewing methods. We package our beer in self-pressurizing mini-kegs that hold the equivalent of a case of beer, half–gallon refillable growler bottles and 1/6 barrel (5 gallon) kegs that can be used in commercial and home draft systems. Some of our specialty beers, like our Cherry Ale, will only be available in limited quantities.
We are a production brewery that sells beer right from the premises. Although we don’t currently have a tasting room where we can sell beer by the glass – we will be offering samples to help you decide which beer to purchase.

We are open to the public Wednesday-Friday 2pm to 7pm, Saturday 12 (noon) to 7pm and Sunday 12 (noon) to 4pm. You can purchase our beers outside of the brewery at The Pour House in Aurora, Indiana, Bakers Discount Liquors in Rising Sun, Indiana and Whitey’s in Lawrenceburg, Indiana. We are also available on draft at Bourbons Bar & Grill in Lawrenceburg, Indiana.

Under the direction of brewmaster Mike Gerhart, we are undergoing a renaissance of rad, a rebirth of cool--throwing a bit of kind into the kettle whenever possible. Our hop-soaked ales are available throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic regions.

breweries.name: LTD Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Using an 8 barrel brewing system makes us one of the smallest production breweries in Minnesota.  We focus on providing constant innovation and imagination to the craft beer enthusiast. Having a small, flexible system allows LTD Brewing to challenge the taste-buds of people who dream for a great beer. We are not bound by a style of beer, ingredients or a predetermined idea of what a beer drinker would expect. We are committed to re-inventing the way beer is brewed and providing an experience, not a drink.

breweries.name: Liberty Street Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Liberty Street Brewing Company began in concept back in 2006, and finally became a reality in the fall of 2008.  We provide an elegant atmosphere where people can enjoy a fine, hand crafted beer in Plymouth, Michigan’s historic Old Village.

Our focus is to provide a large assortment of crafted, small batch ales and lagers through an exceptionally service oriented waitstaff.  We also offer a short list of regularly available food items during all hours of operation, and have special food items to be served during happy hour, weekends and special occasions.  Several local restaurants  deliver other fresh meals right to your table – just ask us for their carry-out menus.

The Upper Hall at the brewery can be reserved for private parties for up to 70 people.  It is a large area with separate restroom facilities, and a small service bar.  The Upper Hall has a sound and video system that can be used for business presentations, home movies, etc.  Inquire for details.

data.name: Steel City
data.description: Walter's version of a California Common. This style dates back to the San Francisco gold rush when German brewers adapted to the California climate. A hybrid between an Ale and a Lager.

breweries.name: Walter's Beer
breweries.description: For 100 years, Walter’s Beer was as much a family tradition as it was a refreshing malt beverage. The Walters family toiled through fires, Prohibition and fierce competition to deliver the classic recipe that gave generations of beer enthusiasts a reason to relax at the end of the day. Your time has come to experience this bold, historic brew.

breweries.name: Empyrean Brewing Company
breweries.description: It began with a dream that we could brew full-flavored beer in the great state of Nebraska. In late 1990 that dream became our state’s first brewpub, Lazlo’s Brewery & Grill. Since then demand for our beer has grown, so we expanded our pub and Empyrean Brewing Company was born. Today we still dream big even while we hand craft our beers in small flavor–filled batches. So enjoy an Empyrean beer, the taste of dreams come true.

data.name: Sutter St Common
data.description: The Common style beer is to California what Sutter Street is to Folsom, uniquely original.  We thought it truly fitting to brew this classic style. Made with a unique lager yeast and fermented in between lager and ale temperatures, Sutter Street Common a crisp, dry beer made  with North American Pale, Medium Crystal, Victory and Chocolate Malts and ALWAYS hopped according to style with Northern Brewer hops.

breweries.name: Lockdown Brewing Co
breweries.description:
Welcome to Lockdown Brewing Co., the “Home of the Folsom Prison Brews.”  Lockdown Brewing Co. brews craft ales for the enjoyment of beer lovers of all levels from the true connoisseur to the weekend beer lover. 
The beers of Lockdown Brewing Co. are hand crafted with all natural ingredients without adjuncts such as cereal, rice or fillers. Our beers are superior because of the brewmaster's attention to detail, his complete love of brewing and the freshness of the beer.

The beers are named in the spirit of the history of Folsom, CA. Lockdown Brewing Co. exhibits the rich history of Folsom and the Folsom Prison through its identity and labeling.  Folsom was home to many firsts.  It was the home to the first Railroad in the West and the first city to transport electricity over the wire over several miles, 22 to be exact. The prison is California’s second oldest and has been made famous thru media like Johnny Cash’s “Folsom Prison Blues” and the movie "Walk the Line".

We invite you to sample our fine ales and enjoy the great taste and absorb the long history of Folsom.

breweries.name: The Brewer's Cabinet
breweries.description:
Our small batch brewery allows us the flexibility not to be limited by popular fads, current trends or industry pressure in crafting our beers.

Our Brew Masters have been fully empowered so that there are no limits on creativity or style. We only ask that they do what they do best and brew with passion and love. We will also be featuring an impressive selection of guest draft handles and bottle selection to help compliment our own beers.

With a small kitchen onsite, we will be creating a fresh and local menu for our customers with an emphasis on quality ingredients that pair superbly with our brews. We want to create a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere for our customers, so that they can enjoy the environment no matter what time of the day, nor what the occasion is.

The Brewer’s Cabinet will focus on spreading awareness of the local brewing community. We hope to feature local commercial breweries and their great beers, which we hope will lead to a series of collaborative projects in creating new beers. We want a strong local home brewing community, that is part of the brewery, with the invitation to come in and help design beers with our brew masters. We truly want to be a “Brewer’s Cabinet” for the Reno area!

data.name: Tarnation
data.description: Brewed in a style born in 19th-century California, Tarnation is Baxter Brewing’s first lager. American crystal malts provide light toast and caramel notes along with the beer’s rich amber hue, while Munich malt supplies Tarnation’s malty body. The complex malt notes balance the ample bitterness of American Northern Brewer hops (the signature hop for this style) giving the beer great balance. An authentic San Francisco lager yeast ferments the brew, yielding a clean, crisp and satisfying beer. This lager requires several weeks of cold conditioning (“lagering”), but we think it’s worth the wait.

style.name: California Common Beer
style.description: California Common Beer is light amber to amber in color and is medium bodied. There is a noticeable degree of caramel-type malt character in flavor and often in aroma. Hop bitterness impression is medium to medium high and is balanced with a low to medium-low degree of fruity esters and malt character and give an impression of balance and drinkability. Hop flavor and aroma is low to medium-low. California Common Beer is a style of beer brewed with lager yeasts but at ale fermentation temperatures. Diacetyl and chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Baxter Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Baxter Brewing Company is the first craft brewery in New England to can its entire line of beers. Located in the historic Bates Mill in Lewiston, Maine, Baxter beers are currently distributed throughout the state of Maine.

Founded by company President & CEO Luke Livingston (who is joined by Director of Brewing Operations/Head Brewer Michael LaCharite), Baxter Brewing Co., LLC is the first craft brewery in New England to can its entire line of beers. Located in the historic Bates Mill in Lewiston, Maine, Baxter beers are currently distributed throughout the state of Maine and are expected across the rest of northern New England in the summer of 2011. For more information, please visit www.baxterbrewing.com.

breweries.description: Harsens Island Brewery will be offering year round and seasonal products that will be distributed in kegs to local pubs, taverns and restaurants throughout Michigan. Some styles will be canned and available on store shelves. The taproom at the main production facility offers a large selection of styles including many which will not be distributed.

breweries.name: Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in beautiful Broad Ripple in Indianapolis, Indiana, Scotty's Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company opened on January 17, 2011. Thr3e Wise Men will not only brew beer but will also be serving pizza, appetizers and desserts.
Thr3e Wise Men greets its guests with a classic lodge feel - exposed beams, concrete floors and warm wood walls.  Of course, Scotty prides himself on staying ahead of the technology curve and wanted to be the first one of the first Indiana restaurants to adorn dining room tables with Apple iPads so customers are able to learn more about Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Co., the beers, and Scotty's two other restaurant concepts.

data.name: The Citizen
data.description: The California Common almost disappeared after prohibition as did the term Cismontane. Our interpretation of this style is a golden warm fermented lager with sufficient hop aroma. As a brewer and citizen of Cismontane California it is our obligation to produce a fine Californian Common.

breweries.name: Cismontane Brewing
breweries.description:
Cismontane Brewing Co. was started by two native southern Californians, Ross Stewart and Evan Weinberg. They chose the name Cismontane because the geographical area it represents, coastal Southern California from Santa Barbara to San Diego. As a brewery we are dedicated to creating the finest beers to represent the unique culture and diverse natural aspects of this region. Each beer is named after a local feature that is unique to the area.

The Brewery is located on the side of the largest mountain in Orange County in the city of Rancho Santa Margarita. The great views from Santiago peak and the trails through the canyons provide some of the natural inspiration for the beers and the company.

The brewery is small and accessible to all with a warm and comfortable tasting area. So don’t hesitate to come by when in the area.

(cis-mon-tane)

“This side of the mountains”, in reference to coastal Southern California. This was a common term used for Southern California while it was forming its identity during the gold rush and before prohibition.

breweries.name: Barley Mow Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The BMBC is a nanobrewery and tavern in downtown Largo, FL. For all the non-Floridians out there, Largo is located in Pinellas County just north of St Petersburg. We have a 2 BBL system, which means we're able to produce about 4 kegs at a time. We started out with 3-80 gallon fermenters and have already added a 4th, 3 BBL fermenter!
Our tavern has 14 constantly rotating taps. We try to keep a many of our own beers on tap at all times, when we can't fill them, the rest are reserved for only American brews, most of which are Florida born. We also have an awesome wine list.

breweries.nameShortDisplay: Lexington Brewing Company and Wine House
breweries.description:
Think Globally, Drink Locally

Located in historic Lexington, MI the winery offers many award winning wines AND CRAFT BEER for samples, by the glass, and by the bottle. Wine makers Connie Currie and Steven Velloff have created a warm and inviting atmosphere  "Where the past meets the present and good friends come to meet."

breweries.name: Against The Grain Brewery
breweries.description:
Louisville's only brewer-owned brewery is, like most worthwhile undertakings, the product of dissatisfaction with the status quo. The Louisville area has had a number of quality brewpubs for some time now, but still there was simply not enough beer! Against the Grain is an effort to help solve this problem. We maintain a diverse array of beers covering all of the major categories of beer flavor while generating an endless stream of innovative new brews. In short, everything is "specialty" Boredom will be extremely difficult.

Our food is designed with same philosophy as our brewing. Fresh and interesting smokehouse fare with a gastropub flare lets us bring you the very best flavors to stand alone and to compliment our beers. Regular menu changes allow us to take full advantage of the best seasonal ingredients, our chef's whim, and optimal pairing with our dynamic beer list.

Throw your preconceived notions right the hell out the window. We aren't just another brewpub. We are Against the Grain!

breweries.name: Saint Benjamin Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Saint Benjamin Brewing Company is a nano-brewery operating in Philadelphia, PA. The brewery is located in the historic carriage house and stables of the now defunct Finkenauer Brewery. The quickly growing brewery is known for their reinterpretation of classic styles, and designing new creations such as Inca and Liaison Saison. 

The business was established in 2010, and opened its doors in 2014.

data.name: Uncommon California Common
data.description: California Common (amber lager fermented at ale temperatures). European and American malts. Northern Brewer hops. Bavarian lager yeast. Copper in color. Semi-dry. Tasting notes: lightly fruity, grainy, toasty, biscuity.

breweries.name: Town in City Brewing Company
breweries.description: We love our neighborhood. We love how eclectic, unique, and quaint the Heights is. So what better way to honor our home than to name our brewery after it. The heights is known as the Small Town In The Big City. So we decided to name our brewery Town In City Brewing Company in honor of Houston's first official suburb that was established way back in 1896.

data.name: Up River Amber
data.description: This is a classic example of a California Common/Steam Beer, a style that originated in San Francisco.  It is fermented with a hybrid yeast that exhibits characteristics of both ales and lagers.  The malt flavor is grainy and toasty and there is a noticeable amount of Northern Brewer hops.  Unlike the citrusy hops of American Pale Ales and Ambers, the qualities of the Norther Brewer hop can be described as a more woody, piney, or miny type flavor.

data.name: Upstream
data.description: Upstream is an amber-colored beer that derives its flavor from American base and color malts and its flavor is offset by the use of Northern Brewer hops. In the tradition of San Francisco lagers, the hops lend a resinous woody character that adds to a clean hoppy finish.

breweries.name: Black Acre Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Black Acre Brewing Co. is a new small batch brewery located in Irvington, Indiana. The idea for Black Acre initially was conceived in 2010 due to our love of brewing, great beer, and the beer community at large. We created Black Acre with the goal of contributing delicious and unique beers to the community in which we live.

Black Acre hand crafts its ales using a custom fabricated 3 barrel electric brewing system. The brewery will produce four house beers along with an ever rotating selection of seasonal and specialty beers. Distribution will be primarily though in house tap room sales although there will be limited outside distribution. Our beers are not ready quite yet, but stop by for a glass of one of our delicious guest taps and meet the staff.

data.name: Virginia Common
data.description: The Virginia Common is a deep brown-colored hybrid ale-lager. We use Cluster hops, one of the only commonly available hop varieties with North American roots, which impart a light hop aroma. It has a lower ABV than our other beers, and a mid-level carbonation. It is light-bodied, which allows for the toast of the specialty malts to shine. A sessionable ale-lager hybrid that will satisfy almost any beer drinker.

breweries.name: Robson's, Shongweni Brewery
breweries.description:
Nestled in the heart of the picturesque Shongweni Valley, the Shongweni Brewery is home to Robson’s Real Beer, one of South Africa’s oldest craft beers that pioneered bottle conditioned beers in South Africa and introduced beer lovers to IPA’s, Steam Beer and sparkling ales.

Motivated by the variety of beers produced around the world, we set out to create our own handcrafted beer using only the finest ingredients in our natural processes, and no artificial additives. Just real, good beer for real beer lovers.

Up next for Robson’s

We’re looking to jump continents by making our beers available internationally.

Visit “Products” to see our range of available beer.  Our 3-bottle gift packs are on sale for only R90/pack… ideal gift for family, friends and corporate.

data.name: West Coast Steamer
data.description:
Originally created in the San Francisco bay area, this lager is brewed using a unique strain of yeast enabling the brewer to ferment at ale temperatures in fermentors called ‘coolships’. The original creator of ‘Steam’ beer trademarked the name ‘Steam’ so all other beers in this style are called ‘California Common’ or us ‘Steem’ as the spelling.


Medium bodied
Caramel nose with wood and toasted malt
Amber coloured
Medium malt with a pronounced hoppy finish

data.description: Westy is California Common with a tang of orange peel in the nose, a bready middle, and a lingering hoppy finish.

breweries.name: Sun King Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 27,000 barrels of beer in 2014 while selling all of it in Indiana. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.

data.name: White Fang Lager
data.description: This all-American original style beer has been known for over a hundred and fifty years as the "Steam Beer". Once brewed right here in Virginia, this style is more recently called a "California Common". Author Jack London wrote of this crowd-pleasing light amber beer brewed using Lager yeast, yet fermented like an Ale. The result is a complex and flavorful, yet smooth brew.

style.name: California Common Beer
style.description: California Common Beer is light amber to amber in color and is medium bodied. There is a noticeable degree of caramel-type malt character in flavor and often in aroma. Hop bitterness impression is medium to medium high and is balanced with a low to medium-low degree of fruity esters and malt character and give an impression of balance and drinkability. Hop flavor and aroma is low to medium-low. California Common Beer is a style of beer brewed with lager yeasts but at ale fermentation temperatures. Diacetyl and chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Vintage 50 Restaurant and Brew Lounge
breweries.description: Vintage 50, at this Leesburg, Virginia classically modern brewery.  Whether you enjoy a fine California cabernet paired with innovative New American fare, or a cold beer brewed on-site paired with classic comfort food, you will feel at home at Vintage 50. Guests will relax in style while enjoying libations from near and far as well as a menu that features fresh, seasonal ingredients.

data.name: Workman
data.description: A light lager hybrid with flavor? That’s what this Alabama Common is. Clean and crisp like a lager, but with the beautiful citrus flavors of Citra hops and Rye to compliment the traditional Northern Brewer hops and hybrid yeast. Incredibly drinkable, but tastier than its lighter, thin, mass market siblings.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: California Common Beer
style.description: California Common Beer is light amber to amber in color and is medium bodied. There is a noticeable degree of caramel-type malt character in flavor and often in aroma. Hop bitterness impression is medium to medium high and is balanced with a low to medium-low degree of fruity esters and malt character and give an impression of balance and drinkability. Hop flavor and aroma is low to medium-low. California Common Beer is a style of beer brewed with lager yeasts but at ale fermentation temperatures. Diacetyl and chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Blue Pants Brewery
breweries.description:
Blue Pants Brewery was born out of a love of craft beer and craft beer culture. This first brewery is meant to be a gateway to the second and an inspiration to other small brewers that it can be done on this scale with a healthy amount of hard work. We’ve already had phone calls and emails from other brewers who are planning to follow in our footsteps, and we provide any help that we can. 

The Brewery will consist of a 1.5 Barrel (or about 45 gallon) brewing system. Initially, distribution will be in 1/4 Barrel kegs to bars around the area, draft only. All the beer will be keg conditioned prior to distribution to ensure that it is at its maximum freshness, finishing the fermentation the moment it is loaded on a refridgerated truck out of the brewery.
